title: What is the meaning of "consciousness" and "illusion of difference" in "The Demon of the Snows"?
first_phrase: In the previous text, Milarepa speaks of the principle of error and the destruction of the illusion of difference, leading to awareness. In the last 200 tokens, he reflects on the distinct presentation of phenomena to consciousness and the power it gives him over his fears and desires. He metaphorically links the rising and disappearing of natural and human phenomena to the cycle of birth and death. He concludes with the idea that ultimate truth arises from the self and returns to the self.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the journey towards self-discovery and enlightenment involves recognizing that all our emotions and experiences emerge and dissolve within us. By understanding the true nature of our being, we can overcome the illusory appearances of the external world and attain a state of inner peace and fulfillment.
